body.name: Runnatal Large Dish Drying Rack with Drainboard Set, Extendable Dish Rack, Utensil Holder, Cup Holder, Expandable Dish Drainer for Kitchen Counter
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: 【Expandable Design】The tableware drying rack adopts an expandable design, suitable for small home kitchens, with a width range of 21.65-30.31inch (including cup holders).
【Large Capacity】It can hold up to 11 plates, 4 cups, and full-size pots and pans, and the detachable cutlery box can hold forks, western food knives, etc.
【Rotating Water Outlet】The kitchen drain rack can drain water quickly, and the 360°rotation of the water outlet can drain the water directly into the sink.
【STRONG FRAME】The utensil holder and drainer set is constructed of a sturdy frame, 2 rubber non-slip feet make it stand on the counter stably and prevent the counter from being scratched.
【High-grade Material】The kitchen utensil strainer is made of high-grade PP plastic and carbon steel (iron), which is durable and does not rust, it is your perfect kitchen utensil.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Product parameters Model: WK810605 Material: high-quality carbon steel (surface treatment powder spraying/wire diameter 4.5/3/4.9/4, flat iron 2*10) + high-quality PP Accessories: PP drip tray / PP knife and fork barrel / TPR foot cover / PP water guide / bamboo cover / 304 self-tapping screws / TPR opening foot cover / cup holder

Features: The dish drying rack is made of high-quality carbon steel (iron) and high-quality plastic, which is anti-rust, anti-scratch and anti-fingerprint, which enhances the durability of the product and can place daily kitchen utensils without deformation and discoloration. LARGE CAPACITY: The large compartment allows you to store utensils of various sizes. The kitchen utensil drying rack has attachments for more utensils. Make your kitchen more clean and tidy. Rotatable Spout: The rotatable spout can be adjusted in 4 directions according to your needs. Plus, it's removable for quick and easy cleaning. Regular cleaning will have a longer service life. Anti-Scratch Attachment: This dish drying rack with drain board is equipped with 2 non-slip feet, which can perfectly prevent slipping and protect your countertops and cups. Multifunctional cutlery holder: Extra cutlery barrels and cup holders can keep your kitchen utensils in the right place. Keep everything in place while drying.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a LARGE capacity drying rack that was versatile and well-functioning. I found it! I love it. It's so spacious and you can move the top rack for plates to your sink and move the cutting board holder and your silverware holders around where you want them. I had never seen a drain board with this little spout and this one has it! It drains right into the sink instead of just sitting stagnant. It's super sturdy (not cheap-made) and easy to assemble.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Took me about an hour to figure out how to put it together. The bottom was not easy to slide on the cup rack. You cannot actually put cups next to each other. You can only put a cup on every other slot. They were not spaced out, but everything else on here is great. I love this dish rack, it keeps the water off my counter. It even has a draining slide to go straight into my sink. It looks great in my kitchen and honestly it doesn’t take up that much room on my counter, but it holds a lot of dishes. I do not have a dishwasher, so this is been a game changer And I no longer have to play dish Jenga.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Just a couple of flaws but otherwise works very well
reviews.reviewText: I needed something for a narrow space. Counter space in my kitchen is valuable and limited real estate! This fit perfectly. I love the way the drain is adjustable and empties into the sink. The sturdiness criticism comes from the cup holder. I wish it had some sort of snap to hold it in place better. It falls off easily if there is nothing in it, and I'm afraid if it gets bumped while holding cups, it will break. So, I'm not a big fan of the detachable cup holder. Otherwise, this does a great job and I really like the knife holders.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I thought it was a little bit over priced but I actually think it was worth it. Almost everything about it is good. Nothing is falling off or breaking. So I’m ok with the price. No retuning something. I have returned so many things this year because items were broken, missing parts or were garbage. So this is a large and sturdy dish rack. It’s big enough for a family of dishes. Love the knife holder and how many items can fit without it collapsing, Drain spout is nice. I live in a house that was built in the Stone Age so this rack helps me by utilizing my small counter space so I can cook and stack my bowls and stuff so they’re out of my way,I’m happy with this purchase and rambling :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super cool dish rack!
reviews.reviewText: This is the one! Perfect for small spaces. Holds an entire sink of dishes. The extender is useful and I love the 360 drain spout. No more wet and moldy dish drying mats! I don't expect it to last more than a year but I replace them regularly anyway because they take so much abuse. I highly recommend this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is clever and someone put a lot of thought into it but it's a little over engineered and rickety. The plates: in the photo fit in it pretty well but yours may not.The rotatable drainage trough seems to work pretty well. You have choices as to where to place the rack next to your sink.The drain pan extention may not work that well, and the silverware rack is a bit challenging.The knife rack may not drain at all. You have to empty it later.You can use the different components separately such as putting the dish drying rack in the sink. I can see doing that while you let the pots dry in the regular rack.I'm keeping this as a back up for clean up after large dinners.I also bought the large, expandable Kitchen Aid drying rack and seem to like it better. It's big and simple and easier to wrap your brain around.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I placed ours vertically instead of horizontally on our counter and it fits perfectly, and because it's not that wide, I was able to free up a little extra counter space too. When you first open up the box, it looks like there are a lot of pieces but there really isn't. I opted not to use the cup thingy. The sides are a little low so I had to get used to stacking dishes a slightly different way, but other than that, it's been working out great for my household. After reading some other reviews, I tested out the drain spout by pouring multiple cups of water over the basket but it never leaked on me. Sometimes it will drain, then slow down and then drain some more which is funny to look at but everything has worked as described. It doesn't mention it in the description but the extendable part interior is on a slant which forces the water to not be stagnant which I like. And you can't really tell from the product pics but the utensil holder has drain openings on the one side so you don't have to worry about water staying inside the holder. I wish it came in a more glamorous color than black but that's just me being picky. Besides it fitting my counter completely how I like, I think my favorite feature is that the inside part doesn't have huge wire racks. It allows me more freedom to use that space without wires getting in my way. I can still stack plates and lids if I want but with the lower interior, I can put my pots and pans however I want.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Just what I was looking for. I love that it expands. Great quality. Mine did not leak at the bottom like some reviews stated. It’s versatile, which I like. It was packaged nicely.
